title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: As is known to everyone, there are lots of advertisements that have been created during this medium period. some people think advertisements make products seem the same as they really are. on the other hand, some people don't think so. In my opinion, i agree with the statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. The reasons why i agree are as follows. First of all, advertisements become more creative and interesting, owing to attracting more buyers to buy their products. If the advertisements are really boring, there is no one who will be persuaded to buy their products. What's more, there are lots of products in the world. Some sellers suffer more pressure about how to get an important role in this market, As a consequence, the advertisements will show more information about such good products they sell. Even though, the products are really not as good as the advertisements present them to be. Worst of all, it's a negative cycle. Lots of advertisements follow this kind of trend to gain more profits from consumers. By way of conclusion, i totally agree with this statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. In order to attract more buyers and then earn more money, the advertisements make products which become more amazing and creative, but they really are not. It is a really negative cycle in our society. However, many people don't pay much attention to this issue. What a pity it is.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Most young people and old people enjoy their lives. Some people might say that young people do not enjoy their lives because they have to study hard and find jobs for their future. However in modern society most of them enjoy their lives more than older people. Older people have to earn money for their kids and have responsibility for their own families, but young people have various ways to play such as computer games and TV. They can also have a lot of food if they want because of their parents.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: It is not better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject. It may cause a huge problem because if a lot of people know a little about many subjects, how do they teach something in detail about a specific subject to another? Also how do people become a teacher with this little information? How can knowledge be improved with a little information about a subject? That is why it is better to specialize in one specific subject than to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects. Lets consider that there is a little population on a small piece of land and they know little information about every academic subject like geography, biology, history, physics. etc.
sents: ['It is not better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject. It may cause a huge problem because if a lot of people know a little about many subjects, how do they teach something in detail about a specific subject to another? Also how do people become a teacher with this little information? How can knowledge be improved with a little information about a subject? title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: Nowadays, some people prefer to travel through a travel agency while others prefer to travel by themselves. There are some advantages to traveling in groups led by a tour guide such as safety and getting some information about the place we travel from a tour guide On the other hand, there are some disadvantages such as following rules and no private time. I prefer to travel in a group led by a tour guide. There are three reasons why i prefer to travel through a travel agency. The first reason is that I am worried about safety when I travel. if we travel in a group, it is safer than travelling by myself. I heard some tragic stories about a couple in China. The couple who had just got married in Korea, went to China for a honeymoon.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Yes i agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do. I think in all respects young people enjoy it more than older people. I think younger people have less responsibility than older people. If any one has some responsibility they may not enjoy it like less responsibility people. I observed some points in my friends. Some of my friends do not have any restrictions or responsibility. They enjoy a lot of everyday life. It is not possible for older people because mostly they have some responses during old age. Like their children's education on other financial problems. But these young people dont have such types of problems. And some more reasons for this are health problems. Young people are more active than older people or not. Young people can enjoy themselves without taking any rest for so many hours. Where as olders cannot do this. A better example of this is every weekend i prefer to go to some pubs in my city. I can find a lot of youngsters and olders. I observed that young people dance till late at night. But it is highly difficult for older people. Another best example to state this opinion is my life style. I am a very crazy person. I always want enjoyment in my life. I have a lot of friends. I am very crazy about making friends.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: Now there is a general debate about whether it is better for people to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects or to specialize in one specific subject. Different people have different ideas. As far as I am concerned, I think that it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects. There are a lot of reasons to support my idea, but I will only explain some of them due to the limited time. To begin with, if people have broad knowledge of many academic subjects, it will be easier for them to find jobs. That is to say that if you study a large amount of subjects, you may gain job opportunities very quickly and change jobs freely. A good example is the part-time job. If you have lots of knowledge of many academic subjects, you know both English and Ecnomics well, then there will be many jobs readily available for you. Working as a manager in a big company to show you economic skills during weekdays, you may teach English in a training school, standing in front of the blackboard, pronounce "A. B. C". This experience will be extremely interesting for you, you must enjoy it very much. The second reason is that you may be more intelligent by studying many academic subjects. Recent research has shown that people who learn knowledge in different areas will be more clever than those who only specialize in one scientific subject because these people's ideas are mangled to jump from one field to another field easily.

This experience will be extremely interesting for you, you must enjoy it very much. The second reason is that you may be more intelligent by studying many academic subjects.', "Recent research has shown that people who learn knowledge in different areas will be more clever than those who only specialize in one scientific subject because these people's ideas are mangled to jump from one field to another field easily."]

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: Every one on earth has his own ideas that could impress or depress the environment around him. The presence of these ideas does not cancel the fact that facts are dominant in our world. There is a huge difference between the two concepts and most people get mixed up between the two. Ideas are a special state of a person's own inspiration and thoughts like the idea of inventing a time machine while Facts are things that remain unchanged for the rest of life like the fact that the Sun revolves around Earth.

There is a huge difference between the two concepts and most people get mixed up between the two.', "Ideas are a special state of a person's own inspiration and thoughts like the idea of inventing a time machine while Facts are things that remain unchanged for the rest of life like the fact that the Sun revolves around Earth."]

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: This is a very hard discussed question and I believe everybody you ask tells you a different answer about this aspect of the generation gap. But with the tendency that always the other group is accused of being more enjoyable than the one you belong to. So everybody's opinion as a young or older person could be affected by such an influence. Thus I am trying not to be affected by such group thinking. I would say the majority of our society is enjoying their life, although older people do it more. Surely one could say the young are lazy and the only thing they have in mind is making a party. But I think that relates to their younger and more active body and mind. And I am convinced the relatively short time young people party cannot be compared to the long periods the older people sit around watching tv, playing poker, or spending their free time in female chatting clubs. Of course there may be several older people that use their time efficiently by working, keeping the front yard nice or being active in a sports club. There are also people who are ill and cannot do what they have in mind. But in summary I want to make a statement about the mean, the normal, older person. Young people are simply doing much more, in both fields enjoying and working, than older people.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: There are some differences between young people and older people. I want to explain important points about their characteristics. First, young people are more active because they have to go to school, they have to learn what their requirements  are. They also have to grow to become what they want to be. Though, they are growing up, there are a lot of struggles that they have to face. They are confused and lost because they can not see what is going to happen next. Second, think about older people who are calmer and have knowledge, and go done with their development. They can do whatever they want to do because they finish high school. They may have time to think about their grand children who they got. But there are things that they can not do which is going to school, playing sports beyond their average , being expert at some new thing. So some limits come up to them because their age is increasing. But it doesnt mean that young people enjoy life more than older people do. For example, if you want to have your own time to relax, sleep, talk with friends, it seems like young people have time for those kinds of things, but young people may not do it because there are a lot of things to do like home work, sports club, planning for university or job. But older people may do it because they have time, maybe they are having a job that they really want to do. School work is hard to have fun, there is such a limited time, they are still struggling with everything. Older people can enjoy what young people enjoy, if they want to play sports as much as young people do then they can do it.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: I agree that most advertisements make a product seem much better than they really are. These days the advertising has become so popular that some people even have this belief that they can not sell a product at all with out advertising it on television or radio or wall posters. The first and the foremost thing in most of the advertising industry is presenting something bigger better or more unrealistic than the usual product. These days there are advertisements for everything from a mole hill to a mountain. And these days with the advancements in media (radio, television , the internet) the advertising has become so easy and so effective that it is delivered to each and every person and anyone who encounters that advertisement tends to buy that product. They are so impressive. Even if we go to a gas station there is a discount, for clothes, for medicines ,,,,, for every thing there is some bonus (so called) to the customers, which is just ,in my opinion, another start to improve their business and get profits. The other day i was walking in a street and i saw that on the other side of a road there was this man beginning with a note in his hand "need food" and when i looked at him and tried to walk away he had taken out another note with" Need booze" and asked me to give him some money for what ever note i liked. He really advertising more than his needs or showing something to others which isnt true. he has money but its just that he doesnt want to work at all. Here is another incident , i saw this advertisement in the news paper stating that there is a store wide discount with a note on the front of the shop"out of business store closing after 15 days" and i went there.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: I am happy. I am young, and I am happy. I have never been old in my life so I can not know if I agree or disagree with the statement, basing myself on my own life experience. But I can answer based on what I have lived through this time and on what I have seen around me during this time. And I will say that I agree. There are a lot of advantages to getting older. Older people have more freedom (they can do whatever they want to and do not have to ask anyone), they earn their living on their own so they are able to plan better than young people because they do not have to rely on their parents. But I am still thinking that young people enjoy life more than older people do. There are just many more things to do, things to enjoy, for young people. They do not have as many responsibilities as older people, so they do not have as many things to worry about. For example, I said that older people have more freedom, earning their own living. It is true. But what I did not say then, is that there is more fun, to me, in enjoying life basically, without any trouble in mind, or much less important ones. Furthermore, young people often have many more possibilities to meet new people and make new friends than older ones. Older people have to have a job to earn their living.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: In this era, where it is possible to underline an increase in production, most advertisements can make products seem much better than they really are. This is a result of a great number of products that the owner of the companies has to sell to the consumers. For this reason i agree with that statement. I think that ,in this period, everyone who has to sell anything wants to show it in a better way than it really is. It is possible to find products that have a very low price but at the same time they are probably not very good items. Now where the Internet has increased its importance in selling products, all people try to show them in a fantastic state with beautiful pictures and one very accurate description. For example one year ago I bought a support for a mobile phone for the car. When it arrived at home I observed it and I noted that it was not as good as on the computer. The material that it was made of was very very bad and an optional item, that I bought with the support, didn't arrive at home. It' s possible to find a lot of advertisements on television that show all the items in a very beautiful way and I think that anyone has to pay attention before buying a particular product. I think it is better to buy items of a brand that is known. In this way you are sure to buy a good item if its price can be expensive. The most important brands have a great experience of working and they use all kinds of machines or material they need. In this capitalistic era infact there are many people that open an industry to sellingproducts. To have very low costs they use a material that is not good. This occurs for example in China where the prices of the products are very cheap. I had a lot of experiences with buying a product that were not good as they were shown, for this reason I suggest buying a very famous product! !.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Advertisements have been increasing a lot during the last 30 years. Does it work or is it just an illusion ? Knowing how much money companies are willing to spend in an advertisement I have to say it must work. Now there are some more reasonable ways of responding to the question. We could talk about packaging forinstance. Between products that offer the same thing, that are at the same price, I would rather choose the best looking one. For me the product aspect reflects its real quality. In this case the true problem is comparison. I don't think you make a product seem better than it really is, the point is making the product seem better than the other products ! I think this is really working. There is another way of advertising a product : getting the buyer to know the product before he even gets to buy it : advertising in magazines and  on television. In my opinion, this may be more efficient because the buyer won't necessarily compare the product to the other ones. He will just get in the store and search for that exact product because he has been told it is the best. In this case it is true that advertising is used to make the product seem better than it really is.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: I agree with this statement the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. there are alot of benefits some of these benefits are knowingthe location , may be i have a question and he will tell me about a good place. First of all, the tour guide will tell me about all the locations and directions in the city in this case i will have a safe time and alot of money. For instance, last summer i went to rome in italy with my family and we have a tour guide to help me and my family to know every thing about Rome now. Second, when i go to any interesting place may be i have questions about something and the tour guide will answer me for any thing. For example, two years ago i went to spain in barcelona city and i had a tour guide and we went together to watch a soccer match in nokamp stadium and i asked a tour guide about this subject, what date is it established? and he answered me it was in 1877.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Nowadays a lot has been said about the role of the advertisement in contemporary society. Some marketing practitioners have defended the idea that marketing and, in particular, advertising keep playing a neutral role in modern society by only promoting the features of a product. On the contrary, among academics and most of the public opinion, this claim has completely been rejected. In my opinion this second position best highlights what the actual situation really is: Products are overpushed through the advertising channels by mistelling what they really value for the final customer. Ever more commercials promise customers greater benefits from their products misleading the real wants and needs of them. Modern advertising is able to manipulate the customer's will and often convince him/her to buy products not really wanted. It may also happen that the features illustrated by the commercial are really disappointing to the customer when this experience the product. Furthermore, by lying to the customer through advertising, the firm can really harm the final consumer. This is the case with those kinds of products that cause accidents for the user.

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: I totally agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing familiar things. In my opinion, successful people, especially in the business world, can usually imagine things that will happen in the future. They can also see the trend of life therefore they can prepare for the change of life and try new things that may lead them to success. On the other hand, people who only do what they are familiar with do not have this kind of sight and ability to create things. To be a successful person, you have to be a pioneer to try new things. In the business world, "Time is Money". People do not only compete with others, they also fight for time. Time is the factor that determines success or failure. Therefore, trying new things is the key to success. People who do not take this kind of risk can never be success.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Young people are more likely to enjoy life than older people. Age factor is one of the main reasons that put life of older people within limits. First of all, most sports require an age limit, such as Tennis and Football. As an example, my father loves Football but he can no longer play it, because he cannot run as fast as he used to. Another example is Mountain Climbing. Most mountain climbers are young because this kind of activity requires good heart rates and endurance, and as we all know, the older a person gets, the less his heart operates due to age factor. Second, older people have less sex drive than they had before.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: Towards the statement that "It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject", I would say that I agree with this statement. There are several reasons to support my belief. Firstly, specializing in only one specific subject would make a person become abstract. Concentrating on training students in one specific subject may have a harmful effect on children's development. If children receive specialized training in their studies, it may be too early for them to decide what to learn for their future. A student may choose to study biology in Grade 7, for example, because he likes animals. When he grows up, he may find that the subject is completely different from what he expects and it will be too late for him to switch to another subject. Career prospects are the second issue that I consider. Though having deep knowledge in one specific subject would let people become experts, society only requires a small portion of such kinds of experts, where college professors are the examples. Instead, having a variety of academic knowledge provides people with diverse potential job positions to select from. For example, a person who studies history may only be able to work in a museum.

If children receive specialized training in their studies, it may be too early for them to decide what to learn for their future. Instead, having a variety of academic knowledge provides people with diverse potential job positions to select from.', 'For example, a person who studies history may only be able to work in a museum.']

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: In modern day cars are a very important mode of transport in people's lives. The car has become an integral part of human life. so,i disagree with the statement that in twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today". Cars nowadays are more important than we think. In most of the developed countries, people prefer a car as transport rather than other conventional transportation modes, like trains,buses etc. Therefore, they can say that the car has become a vital part of their day to day life. Cars may cause many environmental problems,but that can be avoided by using pollution free fuels. For example, we know that many car companies are developing new fuels that will not harm the atmosphere,like hydrogen fuel which in turn leaves water as a waste product rather than harmfulgases. Many economies in the world depend on the manufacturing sector where the car industry is one of the important ones to generate money forcountries. There may be different kinds of transportation modes after two years, but there will be cars which are more sophisticated and may not use conventional fuels Car industry has not spread its wings greatly in some countries which are developing now. For example, take India. The Indian economy has risen before. so, there is untapped potential in different industries. One of the markets in India is cars. Many top companies are entering India to tap the vast market. For India, there is also an opportunity to generate new jobs in that market. To cater for cars from countries like China and India, it will take many years. Infact we may see a larger number of cars than today. And after twenty years We may say that there could be fewer cars after twenty years which are on roads now.

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: Going to school is a big issue in life. It can change it just in too many different ways. All this knowledge that you get in all this time makes your life much different than those that never take the chance to go. That is why people who take the chance to do it,must have an open mind to understand ideas, concepts and obviously to learn the facts of any information. When you are talking about topics like children, you must learn about everything, food, games, sickness, parents etc. so this is the idea, "children", but you must learn about concepts, like what is common in them, what is terrible, what is normal in their behaviour, how to treat them, how to talk to them, how to play with them, and when you find all this information and understand it, it will be much easier to do everything with them, so this last part will be the Facts. For example, to coach children skaters you must know first how to skate, then how to teach children , and with all this information you must know how to apply your knowledge tochildren, and during this time you will find that every single kid is different and you have to treat everyone differently. title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: The reason that the younger generation seem to enjoy life more than the older generation is that they seem to have a greater ability to make what they desire come true. this could be because of the greater energy levels that the younger generation has when compared to the Old. The second reason is the flexible attitude that the young can take. they are easily adaptable to the situation and change accordingly and make the most of things, but on the contrary the old are not that flexible. they do not want to change from the normal routine work that they try to. they are very much used to the old work that they always do and thus they miss enjoying other works which they can.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: When I was 16 years old I traveled with my mother all around Europe. She paid a travel agency to have a guide on our trip. That adventure was amazing! if I had the chance to experience the same situation, I would not have second thoughts about paying a tour guide again. So I completely agree with the idea of traveling in a group led by a tour guide. First of all, I agree with paying someone to show me around because it is the best way to visit everything in a city, in which I do not know anything about. Furthermore, this guide can show me the history, the monuments, the anecdotes, traditional restaurants and places to party, and all of these for the same price! For instance, on the trip that I mentioned at the beginning, the one that I did with my mother, this guide showed us every single place in France; actually my mother went by her self three years before we did and thank this guide she learnt new more things about Paris.
sents: ['When I was 16 years old I traveled with my mother all around Europe. She paid a travel agency to have a guide on our trip. That adventure was amazing! if I had the chance to experience the same situation, I would not have second thoughts about paying a tour guide again. So I completely agree with the idea of traveling in a group led by a tour guide. First of all, I agree with paying someone to show me around because it is the best way to visit everything in a city, in which I do not know anything about.', 'Furthermore, this guide can show me the history, the monuments, the anecdotes, traditional restaurants and places to party, and all of these for the same price! For instance, on the trip that I mentioned at the beginning, the one that I did with my mother, this guide showed us every single place in France; actually my mother went by her self three years before we did and thank this guide she learnt new more things about Paris.']

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: The statement " Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. "has several examples in scientific history that show that it is true. One of them is Albert Einstein, who at the beginning of his professional life had strong difficulties finding a suitable job. He ignored his friends who were arguing about not changing his job and went to a university in Berlin where he developed the theory of relative time. Another example (where the meaning of success is different) is the attempts to kill Hitler during the second world war. These people knew how to survive in Nazi society, but they took the risks of being killed because they believed in what they did. From the point of view we have today they were successful. Another side of the same coin is the recent economic  situation. The value of the firms only depends on their success at the stock fairs. As a result the managers are trained to push these courses and they don't care about their employees (it's not a risky behaviour, because everyone does it). In this case success is a question of the definition. But there is another way to succeed too. Doing continuously the work you know how to do well will give you a smaller but steady flow of success. Because people can rely on you it will have a positive influence on your work. My personal way to success is a combination of personal and professional success. On the one hand you must have the possibility to have i. g. a family. That's why you need professional success, with risky decisions that will allow you to earn more money. On the other hand personal success is never a result of risks.

He ignored his friends who were arguing about not changing his job and went to a university in Berlin where he developed the theory of relative time. Another example (where the meaning of success is different) is the attempts to kill Hitler during the second world war. These people knew how to survive in Nazi society, but they took the risks of being killed because they believed in what they did. From the point of view we have today they were successful. On the one hand you must have the possibility to have i. g. a family. That\'s why you need professional success, with risky decisions that will allow you to earn more money.', 'On the other hand personal success is never a result of risks.']

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Since World war 2 ended, the Young generation has enjoyed their life more than the olders. They, the Would-be Baby-boom generation, were good at various entertainment, and were exposed to splendid media such as Holly wood movies or Broadway musical shows. There are a few reasons why young people are better at having a great time than older people. First, young people know well how to play whenever they want eagerly. They know well where the best bar is, what the trend is going on, or who the most famous actor is these days. Of course older people have no time to have fun in order to get enough money for their family like a daughter who is interested in an expensive jewellerybrand. However young people don't need too much money because they have no one to be preserved. They just maintain their living costs which includes money to go to the best club in Soho. Second, young people are healthier than older people because they have a young and strong body that older people don't have. Old people have to pay for their medical care, medicines in order to maintain the body.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Many people think, young people have enjoyable lives and they think old people do not enjoy life as much as young people do. I agree with people who think like that. I have several valid reasons which support my idea. First of all, young people enjoy life more because they are full of energy and that causes them to do anything at any time. For instance, if a young person decides to do something hard, that person achieves that aim very easily, but an old person can not do that thing easily and it causes disappointment and that disappointment makes the old person unhappy. For me an unhappy life is equal to an unenjoyable life. Secondly, young people have lots of time and because of that, they do not have to be in a hurry to do something , but old people think they have several years to live, so they try to do lots of things at the same time and that makes their lives unenjoyable. Young people are looking forward to the future but old people do not. Old people have disappointment about their past experiences but young people do not because they have lots of time to fix those disappointments. Last but not least, old people have health problems due to, their age. Because of that, they need to stay at hospital or need private support and I think that makes them live their lives unenjoyably. Young people do not have to spend their time in hospitals due to, health problems.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: I whole heartedly disagree with the statement that younger people enjoy more than older people. Enjoyment is a feeling which is felt by people of all ages. There are certain times when each age group enjoys more than the other, all depending upon the problems faced by the age groups which are different in magnitude and time of occurrence. Both younger people as well as older people have problems to face in life. Each age group's enjoyment is curbed because of these problems, but the enjoyment is never far away. Lets take the example of a young boy. He does not enjoy it when he has to give exams, study, or go to school. However, he enjoys it when he goes to play, or when he watches television. In the same way an adult (middle aged) does not enjoy going to work, or working around his or her house. But they do enjoy it when they come back from work, when they are on a holiday, or when they go to a party. In the case of old people as well, they enjoy it as they do not have much work to do and live comfortably on their pension funds. But they face problems regarding their health. So this way every age group has its own share of enjoyment and problems. We cannot draw a fine line comparing who enjoys more or less as there are various factors such as time and society which decide that. Along with this there is also the fact that one's enjoyment can be another's problem. In contrast, children enjoy playing more and studying less. The adults (parents) have problems with that, which curbs their enjoyment of seeing their child study. When the child is forcefully made to study, then the parents' enjoyment becomes the child's problem. In the case of old people, their enjoyment is that they do not need to work.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: In the case of Latin America I think that it is better to have broad knowledge of different subjets because you can manage more activities and realize multi-task jobs. In my own experience, to find a job the recruiters ask you not for specific knowledge in a specific field. They ask you more about the knowledge in different areas that can help you to solve problems. In addition, when I was working I learned about different subjects because my job demanded it. For example, I am Electrical Engineering so I have a background in electronics and technical aspects, my last work was Project Management so I learned about Risk in the projects, financial stuff, logistics, management of human resources. I have a friend, His profession is architect and he reads a lot about different subjects because he is trying to apply mathematics, psychology, and marketing to the decoration of a room. He analizes the psychological profile of his clients and tries to design according to their interests and hobbies. People who have broader knowledge can manage more tasks and can do jobs that others do not know. Its easier to explain how to make something to a person who has knowledge in more fields. On the other hand, some activities require specialized resources for example people who repair, and build airplanes. Those works need specialized knowledge, but need more years of specialization in a field. In conclusion, I'm agree with the statement because for society its better to have people with knowledge of different branches.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I agree with the statement. In twenty years, major changes in technology will take place in our lives, those changes will make transportation so easy that people won't have to use cars anymore. Since the human being was born, he's looking forward to learning more about the world around him, therefore, he invented ways to transport from one place to another. He started with a horse and carriage. However, he wanted to transport faster, so he kept learning and learning until he made cars. Cars are very useful nowadays and in my opinion a person can't live without a car.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: I surely agree!. I am not happy to know this thing, but it is the truth. Advertising is made to convince people that a product is better than all the others. Nowadays the answer is fewer than purpose, so companies need to advertise their products to sell them. In this century, or better in the last fifty years the diffusion of mass media all over the world and the born and capital diffusion of television are the best "friends" of advertising's lies. There are a lot of psychological studies about human behavior to construct a perfect advertisement. There are also some ways to test if an advertisement has been remembered by the public or not. Somebody does a lot of research into behavior in the supermarkets or in the commercial centers, too. Nowadays you can argue that advertisements do not sell a product but they sell a dream. They imply. fulfilling that dream is easy: "you only need to buy that product or service! "However in real life it is different because what television spots suggest you, it does not occur. For example, washing products never function on their own and the first time you use them. when you wash something, usually you need to wash it more and more to clean it if it does not rest with rubbish on! As I have already written i am not happy about this thing but i hope that people will change this way of selling. i do not know how people can change this thing but I am sure that it will occur in a few years.

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: I agree with the statement. Being successful has various meanings, for example economically, socially, and so on? If I am definitely successful at achieving something that others want but don't have or cannot obtain easily, those people who are successful seem to tend to try new things and take risks. Firstly, if they want to continue to be successful, they have to try new things and take risks. In the business scene, successful investors try to look for something new. They always try to do something different from normal. Because only doing something normal cannot lead to making money. By searching for different ways, they can have more possibilities to encounter better ways and unique ideas. By doing the same things as others, normally it doesn't make profits. Second, they are tired of only doing what they already know how to do well. They always like to challenge new things and don't stick to the things they know. They are looking for something that makes them excited. For example, rich people are tired of saving money.

Young people want to have experiments about everything enjoyable.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: What will our planet look like in twenty years? This question is in all the conversations about the consequences of what we are doing today. Will it look better or worse? It's not a debate today but one of the interrogations concerns the use of cars, which are becoming more and more accurate all over the world. On the one hand, we might think that the number of cars will progress significantly in the years to come, thanks to economic progress and innovations in technology. More and more countries nowadays use cars : in China, for example, the car industry is in great development, and as there are really many inhabitants, we must consider that it will be one of the most attractive markets in a few years. But on the other hand, we may add that considerations about environmental protection are taking more and more importance, Sustainable development is a recurrent term in speeches and official documents, more especially, of course, in developed countries, which had already known the excitement of car technology and had also already benefited from its advantages. So the point now is to find solutions to limit the damage to cars to the environment, such as the recent alternatives that are developing in France today. In big cities, the public power is making big ad campaigns in order to attract people to use public transport [bus, metro. ] or to use a bike. So in my view, it's obvious that we would never be able to make the number of cars decrease because of their general use; it's really part of our lives and I think that we wouldn't be able to live without cars, it's now impossible, cars have too many accidents.

It's not a debate today but one of the interrogations concerns the use of cars, which are becoming more and more accurate all over the world. On the one hand, we might think that the number of cars will progress significantly in the years to come, thanks to economic progress and innovations in technology. More and more countries nowadays use cars : in China, for example, the car industry is in great development, and as there are really many inhabitants, we must consider that it will be one of the most attractive markets in a few years. But on the other hand, we may add that considerations about environmental protection are taking more and more importance, Sustainable development is a recurrent term in speeches and official documents, more especially, of course, in developed countries, which had already known the excitement of car technology and had also already benefited from its advantages. title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I completely disagree with the statement that there will be fewer cars in use than there are today in twenty years. I have three strong reasons to support my opinion. The demand for cars is huge. It is spread worldwide and no one can now believe life exists without cars. In America, I experienced we definitely need cars to live especially in rural areas. To go to the supermarket, to meet my friends, to go to school even, we need cars to bring us. It is impossible to walk to the station, if it is located far from one's house. I do not think that this situation and demand will change in twenty years, which is too early. In my country, Japan, the car industry is really huge to support our economy. Japanese people are commonly said to be good at making electrical products including cars. Japanese companies extend not only inside of Japan, but also worldwide. Toyota, Matsuda and Mitsubishi are companies producing a great number of cars all over the world. If there is no need to produce present numbers of cars, these companies will be in serious trouble with the business function of my country. As a way to maintain the present economy, the Japanese government will cooperate with companies. So people continue to buy cars for a long while. Nowadays, I saw great news on the television screen. It is said that some Americans invented a new electric car, which runs faster than the Jaguar and produces no gas at all.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: "Don't judge the book by its cover" is a common saying in English to send a signal to people that they should not be deceived by whatever they see. However, it is not always true because there are other factors that could be borne in mind before approaching such a behavior by a lot of companies. As far as I am concerned , I disagree with the written statement for some economic and moral reasons. Economically speaking, it is true that all companies nowadays think of profits, but they do concern themselves with the satisfaction of the customer. These companies should take into consideration that if they got a customer from a customer, there is a possibility of losing a lot of customers. Especially in countries where customers have the right to complain about the low quality of product. A s a result , the company would lose a lot of money because other people would be encouraged to do so due to incoherent information being exposed in some advertisements. Therefore, companies should think about how much money that they might lose for such stupid behavior. They have already put a lot of money on the advertisement and they are not ready to lose more. Morally speaking, companies should keep a good reputation for the companies.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: Will there be fewer cars in twenty years from now? My instant reply is no, and mainly because I realize how our technology is rapidly advancing, and cars will change, changing only to make people love them more, satisfying urges for beautiful car models, creating more desires to own one. Looking back into the past since cars were first invented, there's a huge big difference in how much cars are owned. Compared to before when only the rich ownedcars, cars nowadays are getting cheaper in price, considering the amount of second-hand cars being sold and how cheap it is to buy one. As time passes, the rich will continue to buy more cars and sell their old ones, and at the same time, the lower class will buy these used cars for a cheaper price. With this cycle going on, more and more people will be owning cars rather than selling them. And why are the rich buying more and more cars? Generally it's because of the constant change in car technology; the desire for speed and unique designs. A stereotype view of rich people is people who buy cars just because of their looks. Car companies looking at this, will exploit this point by coming up with more and more uniquely designed cars. There's a rare chance rich people will disappear and their interest in buying these cars will decrease.

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: Facts can be researched by students in order to improve their knowledge of an idea. There are several ways to support the statement that it is more important to understand ideas and concepts than acquire knowledge of facts. Science requires students to think constantly and develop a critical way of thinking. For example, for a lawyer it is more important to learn how to think logically than to learn a set of laws in order to be successful in his career. A set of laws can change within one period of Congress; this will leave the given lawyer who just learnt a set of laws obsolete. He will need to go to university to learn again the set of laws to be useful in his field.

title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: I agree with the statement that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities. First of all, young people nowadays tend to care about themselves more than paying attention to other people. With a highly developed society, there are many more interesting and significant things occupying young people's minds. For instance, they would like to spend two hours or more reading books in the library or seeing videos and playing computer games at home instead of helping their communities which may gain them nothing in the near future. Furthermore, most young people nowadays are not aware of the idea of a "community" anymore. The identity of being part of the community is getting weaker and weaker. Some of them even don't notice about their living in a community. For example, apartments and houses have become the main style of buildings nowadays. Young people leave their houses in the early morning and come back to the very same place late at night. How can we expect them to know each other from their neighborhoods? This kind of lifestyle weakens young people's identity of community. Naturally, they will not pay attention to a society which they are unfamiliar with. Finally, considering this so-called efficient society, tasks relating to communities are almost done by certain workers or employees of these communities. In this way, a community becomes an epitome of a factory. Everyone has his own job and only does what he or she is asked to do. Take my family's community as a real example. We hired four people to do every task in our community.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: Today, when we look at our environment we can see many more cars than in olden times we could see. I disagree that in twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. In passing years, it is observed that the number of cars is increasing fast. I want to focus on reasons to increase cars. The first reason is that the population is growing. Many people start to use their individual cars. All families buy cars for their children or young people buy cars by themselves. For example, in Turkey many families who have 3 or 4 members have at least 3 cars. However, many companies start to improve themselves. They use many cars for their jobs,especially for sales and marketing. They should sell or do their job by car. Another reason is that cars always seem to make people very comfortable. All people want to have a car. Cars are comfortable because, you can go wherever you want, you do not have problems like missing buses and being late for school or work. You are free in a car, because it is yours you can listen to music highly. Although other transporters are produced or the government makes some campaigns for their costs, people do not use these transporters such as trains andbuses. etc. Moreover, government costs a lot of money to produce new highly technology vehicles for transport. These are tried by people but they are not used much. Also, there were many accidents when they were tested.
sents: ['Today, when we look at our environment we can see many more cars than in olden times we could see. I disagree that in twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. In passing years, it is observed that the number of cars is increasing fast. I want to focus on reasons to increase cars. The first reason is that the population is growing. Many people start to use their individual cars. All families buy cars for their children or young people buy cars by themselves. For example, in Turkey many families who have 3 or 4 members have at least 3 cars. However, many companies start to improve themselves. They use many cars for their jobs,especially for sales and marketing. They should sell or do their job by car. Another reason is that cars always seem to make people very comfortable. All people want to have a car. Cars are comfortable because, you can go wherever you want, you do not have problems like missing buses and being late for school or work. You are free in a car, because it is yours you can listen to music highly. Although other transporters are produced or the government makes some campaigns for their costs, people do not use these transporters such as trains andbuses. etc. Moreover, government costs a lot of money to produce new highly technology vehicles for transport. These are tried by people but they are not used much.', 'Also, there were many accidents when they were tested.']

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: I agree that young people enjoy life more than older people do because they get more opportunities to play than older people. Another reason that young people enjoy life more than older people do is that they have much more energies than older people and by taking much more risks the younger people get more chance to experience and learn from their life. First of all, younger people get more opportunities to play than older people because they have enough motivation to enjoy playing. For example, at my age, my friends and I play often. We go hiking, dancing on the stage or in the clubs as well, and we also sing and listen to music, which is alot of fun. However, older people do not get alot of motivation like us, so they basically spend their spare time in their home or in the office where they work. Another reason that young people enjoy life more than old people do is that they have much more energies than old people. The old people are too old to go out and have fun because they do not have as much energy as young people.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: I agree with the statement 'Young people enjoy life more than older people do. 'There were two main reasons for agreeing with this statement. They were 'variation of choice' and 'passionate'. For the first reason, young people can have more choice than older people do. Usually older people have less opportunities than young people have because of their age and also they have worse health than young people do. Also when older people get hurt, they recover slower than young people do becauseolder people 's cells are too old to reproduce themselves. This has caused older people's choices to become limited. For example, oldies cannot ride a ski or snowboard as young people do dangerous tricks because they have more risk than young riders have.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: I agree with the statement 'Young people enjoy life more than older people do. 'There were two main reasons for agreeing with this statement. They were 'variation of choice' and 'passionate'. For the first reason, young people can have more choice than older people do. Usually older people have less opportunities than young people have because of their age and also they have worse health than young people do. Also when older people get hurt, they recover slower than young people do becauseolder people 's cells are too old to reproduce themselves. This has caused older people's choices to become limited. For example, oldies cannot ride a ski or snowboard as young people do dangerous tricks because they have more risk than young riders have. The second reason is related to passion. Young people usually have more passion than old people do. For this reason, it is because of hormones and the different amount of experience. Old people have less hormones than young people have and hormones are one of the scientific catalysts that make the brain excited. As a result of this, even if young and old people do the same situation, their excitement is different because of the amount of hormones. For passionate people, the amount of experience also affects a lot. Usually a beginner has more excitement than a veteran does. For example, when two different types of people have the same girl friend, the amount of excitement is different between a lady and a guy who never had a girlfriend because a lady's guy already has experience of having a girl friend. This relationship does not change a lot between old people and young people because old people usually have more experience than young people have.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: As I'm Italian, I can maintain that this statement is probably wrong: actually, my personal experience shows that the trend is the opposite. When I was a child, there were only one car per family and you could have seen the same situation when my parents were young. If you have lived in the early-Fourties of the last century, probably you couldn't afford a car: only rich people had one.

When I was a child, there were only one car per family and you could have seen the same situation when my parents were young.", "If you have lived in the early-Fourties of the last century, probably you couldn't afford a car: only rich people had one."]

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I think I agree with this statement. As far as I am concerned, I think that there are two ideas which can support this statement. First, recently environmental protection awareness has been rising rapidly. People nowadays realize that air pollution is getting worse and worse because of cars. Thus, in order to give their generations a better environment to live in, people may begin to decrease driving cars to the places they want to go. Instead, they will start choosing public transportation, such as MRT, tram, and bus, to get to the place they need to go. Moreover, the payment for a car is not cheap at all. For example, when you get a car, you have to pay for the oil and maintenance. I dare to say it will cost you more money than spending money on taking public transportation. Second, oil is becoming less and less though scientists have done their best to dig oil and find where oil can be. Oil is one kind of natural resource and the formation of oil must be very long, so it is not limitless. However, oil is essential for cars. Without it, people can not start cars at all; then, people will reduce using cars step by step. I think that the above I wrote can explain why there will be fewer cars than today. Just remember that the quantity of oil is limited and one day it will be gone,and the government have spent lots of money on establishing public transportation. Where does the government get the money to create public facilities? It is from people who pay taxes. So, we, people, have to enjoy what we have invested in and live better lives for our next.

First, recently environmental protection awareness has been rising rapidly. People nowadays realize that air pollution is getting worse and worse because of cars. Instead, they will start choosing public transportation, such as MRT, tram, and bus, to get to the place they need to go. Moreover, the payment for a car is not cheap at all. For example, when you get a car, you have to pay for the oil and maintenance. I dare to say it will cost you more money than spending money on taking public transportation. Second, oil is becoming less and less though scientists have done their best to dig oil and find where oil can be. Oil is one kind of natural resource and the formation of oil must be very long, so it is not limitless. However, oil is essential for cars. Just remember that the quantity of oil is limited and one day it will be gone,and the government have spent lots of money on establishing public transportation. Where does the government get the money to create public facilities? It is from people who pay taxes.', 'So, we, people, have to enjoy what we have invested in and live better lives for our next.']

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: In today's modern life every individual wants to understand and be able to estimate the ideas and concepts of the other person. By which he improvises his ideas and overcome withbetterideas than the other person. So I agree with the statement that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. I would like to support this statement for the following reasons. First, By understanding the ideas and concepts we get a clear image of the aspect. For example if we are studying a particular subject. In that subject it is important for us to identify the main idea of the topic and the concept involved in that particular topic. By simply learning the subject without understanding the concepts then it will be a mystery for us that subject even if we spend a lot of time on that. second,By understanding the ideas and concepts we are able to know how to live in society. That means we are capable of dealing with the problems and our clients. For example if we want to drive a car, we must first understand the ideas and concepts that mean how to start the car ,how to accelerate ,how to movegears.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: The question asks about chemistry. In my opinion academic subjects are better to have broad knowledge than to specialize in one specific subject. There are several reasons shown at the bottom, why i disagree. First, the world is developing really fast. A century ago people thought a specific subject was more important than academic subjects. Also number of people still think a specific subject is more important than anacademic subject. I would say that is wrong. If you have a job like writer, musical job, artist or singer that might be better to have broad knowledge of a specific subject. But the world is developing really fast people need to follow the technology. There are how to learn many academic subjects. School in one of good cases. Most of the high school in Korea which I was from, learn more mathematics , physics , chemistry, Biology or computers. I believe the school is better for learning knowledge than other  schools. Second, I will give a different example. Korea has good IT technology. So most people work in the computer part or the science part. There are several examples of academic knowledge. The company also needs employees. The employees also have to have enough knowledge. In case I have a computer company. I need 5 people to work in my factory which makes CPUs.

title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: I do not agree with the assertion because there are more opportunities nowadays for young people to help their communities. With the advent of the Internet or other media, people have become easier to get information that their community needs them to help. For example, in my apartment, the members of the committee announce the advertisement on our community website when they need people to help set up a certain event. And they often receive a lot of responses that say they would like to help. Compared to the past, there are few people informed that they need to help something. Thus, I think more and more young people are involved in community activities because they are more familiar with the internet than the people before, and understand they are in demand. In addition, in my school, university always encourage students to do something that can benefit our community or society. For example, they are encouraged to clean the streets and help teach older people who are illiterate to read. Universities do not pay the students that do service for the community.
sents: ['I do not agree with the assertion because there are more opportunities nowadays for young people to help their communities. With the advent of the Internet or other media, people have become easier to get information that their community needs them to help. title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I dont think that there will be fewer cars in use than there are today because the number of people who use cars is increasing as i see. When i go out, i can not hear her because of the car's voices. Wherever i look i see cars covered all around me. And we see that it is getting worse and worse day by day. 10 years ago i couldnt see so many cars on the roads but today people have to wait for hours to arrive home because of the heavy traffic. The situation is just for my country. If we think about all the countries in the world, the number of cars is horrible. In China most people use bicyclesoutside. But they are alone. Even if the number of cars in use is increasing. If only all people in the world did that. If they did, the roads would be very quiet and also the atmosphere would be cleaner. But if we look at today it is impossible that there will be fewer cars in use. Unlike today the number of cars in use will have increased so much that we will not walk on the streets. If it continues like this it will damage the environment ,too. We are damaging the whole world and in twenty years we will not find anywhere to live. Using cars also causes a decrease in petrol prices. We are consuming so much petrol that it will not be enough. So we can not drive our cars without it. maybe it will be better because if there is no petrol there will be no cars.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: I agree with the statement about traveling with a tourguide with a group is the best way. For the following reasons. You can learn lots of information about the famous places. I t's cheap, you won't be lonely during the trip. And you won't have a problem talking to foreigners. These are the following reasons and examples to the question. The first reason is that by traveling with a tour guide, you can learn a lot of new information about the famous places you are travelling  to. The tour guide can explain all the important things and history about the place and help you understand more easily. The second reason is that it is cheaper when you are traveling in a group rather than yourself. You can save a lot of money and if you are a student this can be an advantage to save money. MONEY is really valuable, that is why everybody is saving it.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: The issue at hand is whether young people enjoy life more than older people do or not. I disagree with the idea that young people enjoy life more than older people do. I believe that older people like life more than young people do for many reasons. First of all, old people enjoy life more than younger people do because they know they are very close to death. They know very well the meaning of death and they will die at anytime. For this reason, they try to spend their rest of their lives very effectively. On the other hand, young people feel that they never die and because of this, they are n't aware of the value of life. Additionally, old people like life more than younger people because they have many reasons to enjoy life. For example, they generally have children and a wife. They need to care about them. They enjoy life because of her family. On the other hand, young people do not have a daughter or son. They are single.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: In most cases academic education provides the possibility of a profound and distinct understanding of a certain subject in Germany. As a basis you have to take several subjects in the beginning and this leads after approximately a year to specialization into one subject. A broader knowledge of more academic subjects could have some advantages regarding more flexible and different approaches to solve a problem. However, this leads to a lack of specific details on evaluating complex problems. One might argue that with a greater diversity of subjects there will be more solutions and the person can go into detail if it is required. But this often requires a lot of time and usually companies are not willing to invest more money and additional time in educating their employees. Hence, specialization if chosen in a smart way can give the applicant for example a significant advantage. On the other hand it has to be ensured that cultural understanding and logical thinking trained by mathematical education has been provided. Therefore, schools that host students in Germany for 12 to 13 years are responsible. Education needs a lot of time implying that further unspecialized subjects are being taught at the universities it even takes longer for a student to be prepared forworking autonomously. According to the benefit of society and a person who accomplishes their studies in a shorter amount of time the conclusion I'm drawing is to ensure broad knowledge in schools and in the first year of university but then quickly turn into specific subjects. This doesn't mean limiting everyone to only one subject. In science there are lots of examples where fields overlap and knowledge of both subjects is the key to interact but it just takes too much time and resources to educate e.

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: Usually, people are familiar with what they used to do. Some people fear new things because they are not sure about them, or because they cannot take risks even if this action could open new doors for them toward a good future. I believe that a person should take this risk sometimes and try new things in his or her life because I think that the ability of our minds is unlimited. Therefore, I completely agree with the opinion that says people who try new things are able to be more successful. In our life, getting risk is a fundamental part of our world. No one can expect what could happen to him or her. So, I think it is worth it to try new things, use new media, or meet new people. Many successful people built their successful on a moment that they were born. For example, the famous actor "Arnold", he can be just like any other actor , but he decided to engage in the political world and now, he is the governor of California State. I consider his decision to be a bold and smart decision because after a few years he would loosen his ability to be good and attractive actor because of his age.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Our civilisation is based on consumption and the economy so more and more industries resort to advertising to sell their products. Advertisements are everywhere so that we can't avoid them, that's why innevitably we are influenced by them, the question is in a good or a bad way? The aim of an advertisement is to make you buy its product by making you dream, by showing you things amazing. When you see an advertisement for perfume with a gorgeous woman taking a bath in gold water, you immediately imagine that when you put this perfume on your neck you will feel like her you will change your life and that men will run after you! And the day you will be shopping you will come across this perfume and it will remind you of the good feeling you had when you saw the advertisement, so you wont resist and buy it. What about the beautiful amburgers you can see on the front of certain food shops? ! They always seem attractive well done with good meat and green vegetables, but when you have it on a plate, what a deception. you could not even recognise the one you have chosen from another! The strategy used to convince people can change ,it depends on the target which advertisements have to persuade. But all the way ,they have to lie to us.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: The goal of advertisements is to show products better that they really are, so i agree with the statement. If business people use advertisements it is only to increase their profits. Because  of that, they need to sell more. By consequence, they have to show that their product is the best. For example, advertisements for French cheese. A "camembert" is the same everywhere. So to increase the sales, they try to increase some aspects like more cream. So with technology and artificial characters the cheese looks better on TV or in papers but in reality it is exactly the same asbefore. When you walk on the road, and you see advertisements you are most of the time attracted by the product. For example a chocolate advertisement , with the reflection of the light on the slab, the brown color is darker so it looks better. But because the aspect of the picture is better, the products look better. So, advertisements play with your sweet taste. Depending on the moment of the year where you are, advertisers play with advertisements. For example, during the christmas period, a certain product looks better than three months ago only because there is a better or different presentation. This is the focus of an advertisement and in this case the only difference for the sale is the advertisement. If you want to raise your benefits, there is also the way : increase the need. For example for a vacuum, the used is the same everywhere but if you underline the fact that it is easy to use or easy to put a board the products lookbetter. But if you think about it a vaccum stays in a vacuum and you will use it exactly the same manner and it is the same product.

title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: No i donot agree with the statement. Youngsters are now a days really looking active to spare time for helping their communities. community may mean by area ,by religion,by race and many other things. Now a days youngsters have been looking to help their home countries in a big way. I have many reasons to support my statement. In the olden days youngsters used to work hard for themselves and their families. But its different in the modern case. youngsters are being in the front row of doing service to all of their communities. They help them in all the fields. Donating blood to the people in need,helping old people , ladies in all aspects. Students are conducting welfare programmes,encouraging poor students by giving scholarships,helping the flood affected people by joining the natural disaster schemes and many more to tell. The young people who are working in corporate jobs have been sparing time on saturdays and sundays to serve the needy. They enjoy the happiness of helping in such a way. I had an example to support my statement. The following example took place in my native place guntur. A small boy who is affected with a viral fever named denguea fever is in need of blood as the blood from his body has been completely going out. So one student gave 2000 rs to that person's father and asked him to give an advertisement regarding the need for blood. As my blood group was the same i went to the hospital to donate. By the time i went there were about 800 students who came there to donate. The boy in need is not a brother or relative of anybody.

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: I agree with this opinion. I have some reasons to help my opinion. First, ideas and concepts are always the basis of everything when we make a new product or facts. If someone has only a fact, he/she can use that fact but they can't use proper usage of this fact. We can use our facts to know their ideas and concepts. when I was a child, my uncle gave me an airplane paper craft. I can throw it and it will be flying in the air. It was surely interesting and exciting for me but I couldn't understand why it could fly. It is a childish question but I was so serious. So, I learned to know ideas and concepts are so important at that time. In addition, some people feel annoying about facts if they didn't know ideas and concepts. title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: I agree with the opinion that people succeed more often when they try new things and take risks, rather than only doing what they are already familiar with. There are two reasons for this: motivation and chances. First, when people try something that can be challenging for them, they are motivated. In fact, they try their best. When people try their best, they have more chance of succeeding. However, when people do something that they know how to do well, they do not try their best because they already know what the limit is and what they can do with it. However, when people try new things, they are motivated to learn more about them. Also, they do not yet know how far they can go with it, so they are motivated to know what they can do. Second, when people try new things, they have more chances to encounter something that is in their interest but did not know about the existence of. What they already know how to do well is probably something that other people already know and is familiar to all of them.

When people try their best, they have more chance of succeeding. However, when people do something that they know how to do well, they do not try their best because they already know what the limit is and what they can do with it. title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I don't think that it will decrease the number of cars in just twenty years. I support my opinion with some reasons I describe below. First, Nowadays, cars are one of the most necessary things in our everyday life. Japanese people sometimes express about cars as "legs" in our conversation. For example, a man says "We don't have legs to go to the station. ", then another man said, "We can take a bus. ". The first man said "lags", but of course, its not about real legs.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: "In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. "I do not agree with this statement. The reasons are the following: 1. As the year goes on technology will improve and this will result in manufacturing good cars at much cheaper rates than today. So as the price of cars decreases more consumers will buy cars. This is the simple Demand - Supply principle of Economics. 2. Also population of the world is continuously increasing. The more users there will be and they will use more cars. This will imply the usage of more cars than in today's era. 3. Cars are means of transport. In twenty years business will grow rapidly in differentareas. More packages will have to be delivered or transferred. So this will result in a larger number of transfers hence an increase in the number of cars. 4. In the next twenty years fashion/glamour will also increase.
